table.name: mem
table.column: This word is often used to refer to email among Klingonists.

table.name: mem
table.column: It is the duty of the {jabwI':n:nolink} to {qaw:v} the order.

table.name: mem
table.column: кричать, выкрикивать, выплакиваться, гомонить, накричать, вопить

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the traditional narrator role in Klingon opera.
Это традиционная роль рассказчика в Клингонской опере.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This means to throw or hurl something like a projectile.[1, p.91]
To juggle, that is, to throw objects into the air and catch them in a rhythmic pattern, is {jaDchu':v}.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: 玩雜耍（對象、而不是任務） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
For another example where {-chu':v} on a verb of motion indicates a rhythmic pattern, see {lerchu':v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: To defeat the enemy, be ready to fight alone.
Um den Feind zu besiegen, sei bereit, alleine zu kämpfen.
برای شکست دادن دشمن آماده باش تا به تنهایی مبارزه کنید. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
För att besegra fienden, var redo att slåss ensam. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Чтобы победить врага, будь готов сражаться в одиночку
為了戰勝敵人，準備獨自戰鬥。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Para derrotar o inimigo, esteja pronto para lutar sozinho.

table.name: mem
table.column: May the bile of the vanquished fill your hands.
Mögen deine Hände gefüllt sein mit der Galle der Besiegten.
ممکن است صفرا از غلبه دست های شما را پر کند. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Kan den överlevda gallan fylla dina händer. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Пусть желчь завоеванного врага наполнит твои руки.
願被征服敵人的膽汁填滿你的手。
Que a bílis dos vencidos encha suas mãos.

table.name: mem
table.column: This was the winning replacement proverb entry, submitted by Rich Yampell ({Qanqor:n:name,nolink}), in the proverbs competition at {qep'a' 21 (2014):src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: I demand the blood of the enemy.
Ich verlange nach dem Blut des Feindes.
Eu exijo o sangue do inimigo
This sentence does not appear in canon. It is included here because it is used in some fan ceremonies.

table.name: mem
table.column: Backwards of {vIghaj:sen@@vI-:v, ghaj:v} "I have it", a reference to the George Gershwin jazz standard "I've Got Rhythm".

table.name: mem
table.column: If the verb prefix indicates an object, then the subject is going to a destination associated with the object, which may be marked with {-Daq:n}. If the verb prefix indicates no object, then the destination is unspecified. In that case, a noun marked with {-Daq:n:nolink} indicates the location where the "going" is taking place.[2]

Если глагольный префикс указывает на объект, тогда субъект идет в направлении, связанном с объектом, который отмечен постфиксом {-Daq:n}. Если глагольный префикс не указывает на объект, тогда направление не задано. В этом случае существительное, отмеченое {-Daq:n:nolink}, указывает место, куда идет "идущий".[2]
Some canon sentences don't seem to follow the grammar described in {HQ 7.4:src}, instead using a prefix indicating no object to indicate travel to the destination marked with {-Daq:n:nolink}.

▶ {bIQtIqDaq jIjaH.:sen:nolink} "I go in the river." This means: I'm moving along in the river, traveling in the river.[2] ▶ {bIQtIq vIjaH.:sen:nolink} or {bIQtIqDaq vIjaH.:sen:nolink} (the {-Daq:n:nolink} is optional) This means: I'm moving along to the river, traveling to the river.[2] ▶ {bIghHa' yIjaH:sen:nolink} "Go to jail"[3] ▶ {Ha', ... wIjaH!:sen} "Come, let's go to ... !"

▶ {bIQtIqDaq jIjaH.:sen:nolink} "Я иду в реку." Это значит: "Я перехожу через реку, пересекаю реку".[2] ▶ {bIQtIq vIjaH.:sen:nolink} или {bIQtIqDaq vIjaH.:sen:nolink} ({-Daq:n:nolink} опционален) Это значит: "Я перехожу через реку, пересекаю реку".[2] ▶ {bIghHa' yIjaH:sen:nolink} "Отправляйся в тюрьму"[3] ▶ {Ha', ... wIjaH!:sen} "Давай, пойдем ... !"

table.name: mem
table.column:
The Klingon day goes from dawn to dawn. For the part of a day during which there is daylight, see {pem:n} (the opposite of which is night, {ram:n}).
The parts of a {jaj:n:nolink} are: {pem:n} "daytime", {jajlo':n} "dawn", {po:n} "morning", {pemjep:n} "midday", {DungluQ:n} "noon", {pov:n} "afternoon", {ram:n} "night", {ramjep:n:1} "midnight".
For "days ago" and "days from now", see {Hu':n} and {leS:n}, respectively.

Клингонский день продолжается от рассвета до рассвета. Для светового дня, смотрите {pem:n} (противоположность которому ночь, {ram:n}).
Части {jaj:n:nolink}: {pem:n} "время дня", {jajlo':n} "рассвет", {po:n} "утро", {pemjep:n} "полдень", {DungluQ:n} "полдень(12:00p.m)", {pov:n} "после полудня", {ram:n} "ночь", {ramjep:n:1} "полночь".
Для обозначения "сколько то дней назад" и "сколько-то дней спустя", смотрите {Hu':n} и {leS:n}, соответственно.

table.name: mem
table.column: The Klingon week ({Hogh:n}) contains six days. Days beyond the sixth on alien calendars are simply numbered, starting at {wa':n:num}.[3]
According to Maltz, the numbering of Sunday as "day one" may have been to cater to Americans, who view it as the first day of the week.[2]
[1] {Star Trek The Exhibition:src}, [2] {KLI mailing list 2012.04.01:src}, [3] {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2013:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to the visual phenomenon in the sky, not the technical moment of sunrise.

table.name: mem
table.column: A noisy animal (not a bird) known for making a ruckus at dawn, like a Terran rooster.
ein lautes Tier (kein Vogel) bekannt für sein Krähen wie ein Hahn in der Morgendämmerung
یک حیوان پر سر و صدا (نه یک پرنده) شناخته شده برای ساختن پرتقال در سحر است، مانند یک خروس Terran. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ett slags djur (för oljud i gryningen)
一種吵鬧的動物（不是鳥），在黎明時發出騷動，就像人族公雞一樣。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Um animal barulhento (não um pássaro) conhecido por fazer zaragata ao amanhecer, como um galo terráqueo.
The verb {jach:v} can describe what a {jajlo' Qa':n:nolink} does.

table.name: mem
table.column: While both {DaHjaj:n:nolink} and {jajvam:n:nolink} mean "today", they are not quite interchangeable.[2] See under {DaHjaj:n} for details.
До тех пор, пока {DaHjaj:n:nolink} и {jajvam:n:nolink} означают "сегодня", они не совсем взаимозаменяемые.[2] Смотрите подробности {DaHjaj:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: For a counterfactual (or "irrealis") statement, the phrase {... net jalchugh:sen:nolink} "if one imagines that...", "if it is imagined that..." is used.[2]

▶ {puvbogh targh yIjal@@puv:v, -bogh:v, targh:n, yI-:v, jal:v} "Think about a flying targ."[1] ▶ {tlhIngan SoH 'e' vIjal@@tlhIngan:n, SoH:n, 'e':n, vI-:v, jal:v} "I imagine you are a Klingon."[1] ▶ {tlhIngan SoH net jalchugh, qagh DatIv@@tlhIngan:n, SoH:n, net:n, jal:v, -chugh:v, qagh:n, Da-:v, tIv:v} "If you were a Klingon, you would enjoy gagh."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is short for {QoQ jan:n}, but that term is rarely shortened.
Это сокращенная форма для {QoQ jan:n}, но этот термин редко сокращается.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is the name of the actor who played Kor (see {qor:n:name}).

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a reference to the song "Sloop John B".

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is the name of the {HoD:n} of the {'entepray':n:name} during the time of {puq poH veb:n}.
In Klingon, titles generally go after the name, so "Captain Jean-Luc Picard" would be {janluq pIqarD HoD:n@@janluq pIqarD:n, HoD:n}. Note that {pIqarD:n:nolink} does not follow proper Klingon phonology, since it is an alien name.

Это имя капитана {HoD:n} звездолета {'entepray':n:name} во времена {puq poH veb:n}.
В Клингонском языке, титулы обычно идут после имени, так что "Капитан Жан-Люк Пикар" будет {janluq pIqarD HoD:n@@janluq pIqarD:n, HoD:n}. Заметьте, что {pIqarD:n:nolink} не следует настоящей Клингонской фонологии, пока это инопланетное имя.

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers to a person who has seen or been part of an event.
The 1981 film "Eyewitness" was released in the UK as "The Janitor". The film starred Christopher Plummer (among others).

table.name: mem
table.column: There is contradictory information regarding whether this is a "verb of speech". (See {jatlh:v} for an explanation.) In {HQ 7.4:src}, it is said not to be, but its usage in the {paq'batlh:src} suggests otherwise.[2; 3]

table.name: mem
table.column: быть смелым, быть храбрым, быть дерзким

table.name: mem
table.column: This is said of music.[1, p.71]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This word means "deep" in the physical sense.
Note that in Klingon, "deep space" is called {logh Hop:n}, literally, "far space".
Jacques Cousteau was a renowned deep-sea diver.

table.name: mem
table.column: For "shallow" in a metaphorical sense, see {SaS:v:2,slang}.

table.name: mem
table.column: For "months ago" and "months from now", see {wen:n} and {waQ:n}, respectively.
Для "месяцев назад" и "месяцев спустя", смотрите {wen:n} и {waQ:n}, соответственно.

table.name: mem
table.column: similarly, likewise, in the same way
gleicherweise, auf ähnliche Art und Weise
به طور مشابه، به همین ترتیب، به همان شیوه [AUTOTRANSLATED]
På samma sätt, på samma sätt [AUTOTRANSLATED]
類似地、同樣地、以相同的方式 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
da mesma forma, da mesma maneira
Apparently, MO had originally rejected this as a word in 2000, but had changed his mind by 2009.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: In the {ruq'e'vet:n} dialect, this word is used instead of {Soy':v:1}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Glossolalia is also known as speaking in tongues ({jat:n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: According to legend, these are spirits of the dead that possess the living.

table.name: mem
table.column:
A typical object of this verb is that which is spoken, which might be a language or lecture. The listener is the indirect object and is marked with {-vaD:n}.[3; 4]
The "prefix trick" may be used with this verb: if the verb prefix indicates a first- or second-person object, that person is the indirect object, that is, the person to whom the subject is speaking.[3]
The verb {jatlh:v:nolink} is also used when giving a direct quotation, in which case the verb prefix indicating no object is used (except if the "prefix trick" is applied). The quotation may come before or after the sentence with {jatlh:v:nolink}.[3]
This is one of the few "verbs of speech" in Klingon. In Klingon, quotations must always be accompanied by one of these verbs.[4]
For expressing "read aloud" (e.g., a book), something like {paq mu'mey jatlh:sen:nolink} would work.[6]

Типичным объектом этого глагола является то, что сказано. Это может быть язык или лекция. Слушатель это непрямой объект и помечен {-vaD:n}.[3; 4]
"Трюк с префиксом" может быть использован с этим глаголом: Если глагольный префикс обозначает объект 1-го или 2-го лица, то эта персона непрямой объект по отношению, с кем субъект разговаривает.[3]
Глагол {jatlh:v:nolink} также используется, когда даётся прямая цитата, в каком случае глагольный префикс не указывает ни на какой объект (за исключением, если применен "трюк с префиксом"). Цитата может идти до или после предложения с {jatlh:v:nolink}.[3]
Это один из нескольких "речевых глаголов" в Клингонском. В Клингонском цитать должны всегда сопровождаться одним из этих глаголов.[4]
For expressing "read aloud" (e.g., a book), something like {paq mu'mey jatlh:sen:nolink} would work.[6]

In {TKD:src}, this is defined in the K-E word list as "say", and listed in the E-K word list under "speak". In {TKDA:src}, it is defined in both word lists as "say".
In the {msn:src} newsgroup message, it says only that the verb prefix indicating no object is used for a direct quotation if the speaker is first or second person.[3] It's left unclear if {lu-:v:pref} should be used if the speakers are third-person and plural, but the rule seems to be that a quotation is not treated grammatically as the object of the verb.

▶ {tlhIngan Hol vIjatlhlaHbe'.:sen}[1] ▶ {bIjatlh 'e' yImev!:sen}[1] ▶ {SoQ Dajatlh.:sen:nolink} "You deliver an address", "You make a speech."[3] ▶ {qajatlh.:sen:nolink} "I speak to you."[3] ▶ {tlhIngan jIH jatlh.:sen:nolink} or {jatlh tlhIngan jIH.:sen:nolink} "He/she says, 'I am a Klingon'."[3] ▶ {tlhIngan Hol Dajatlh.:sen:nolink} "You speak Klingon."[3] ▶ {tlhIngan Hol bIjatlh.:sen:nolink} "You say, 'Klingon language'."[3] ▶ {SoHvaD pagh vIjatlh, Human.:sen}[5]

▶ {SoQ Dajatlh.:sen:nolink} "Ты доставляешь по адресу", "Ты произносишь речь."[3] ▶ {qajatlh.:sen:nolink} "I speak to you."[3] ▶ {tlhIngan jIH jatlh.:sen:nolink} or {jatlh tlhIngan jIH.:sen:nolink} "Он/она говорит, 'Я Клингон'."[3] ▶ {tlhIngan Hol Dajatlh.:sen:nolink} "Ты говоришь на Клингонском."[3] ▶ {tlhIngan Hol bIjatlh.:sen:nolink} "Ты говоришь, 'Клингонский язык'."[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: This word does not appear in the word lists in {TKD:src}, but is used as an example in the book.

table.name: mem
table.column: sixth tone of nonatonic musical scale
تن ششم از مقیاس موسیقی غیرتتونونی [AUTOTRANSLATED]
sjätte tonen på den nonatoniska skalan
sexto tom da escala musical não-eletrônica
The tones of the Klingon musical scale (see {yutlhegh:n}) are: {yu:n}, {bIm:n}, {'egh:n}, {loS:n:2}, {vagh:n:2}, {jav:n:2,nolink}, {Soch:n:2}, {chorgh:n:2}, {yu:n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: In the TV show "The Prisoner", the main character is number six ({jav:n:1}).

table.name: mem
table.column: {jav:n:1} in Roman numerals is "VI", and Tim Russ played Tuvok. VI + Russ = virus.

table.name: mem
table.column: болтать, вести непринужденную беседу, вести разговор

table.name: mem
table.column: It is unknown whether there is any difference between this word and {joH:n}.[2, p.41]

This word came about as an onscreen mispronunciation of {joH:n:nolink}.
In {TKD:src} this word is defined as "lord" only, same as {joH:n:nolink}. However, {KGT:src} expanded the definition of {joH:n:nolink} to include "lady". Though not explicitly stated, this extension applies to {jaw:n:nolink} as well.

table.name: mem
table.column: This adverbial always comes at the end of a sentence, and turns the entire thing into an invective.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is one of the few "verbs of speech" in Klingon.[2] (See {jatlh:v} for an explanation.)
Это один из нескольких "речевых глаголов" в Клингонском.[2] (Смотрите {jatlh:v} для пояснения.)

In the {HolQeD:src} interview, Will Martin suggested that a typical direct object of this verb is the person addressed. This was not contradicted by Marc Okrand, but not explicitly affirmed, either.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This verb is made up of {ja':v} plus the suffix {-chuq:v}[1, p.66]. In spite of this, it seems that it can take the topic of discussion as its object, although the exact grammar is unclear.[3]
Глагол составлен из {ja':v} плюс суффикс {-chuq:v}[1, стр.66]. Невзирая на это, похоже, что он может принимать тему обсуждения как объект,хотя точная грамматика неясна.[3]
▶ {'uQ wISoppu'DI' maja'chuq.:sen:nolink} "We will talk after dinner."[2] ▶ {quv HIja'chuqQo'!:sen:nolink} "Don't speak to me of honor!"[3]
▶ {'uQ wISoppu'DI' maja'chuq.:sen:nolink} "Мы поговори после ужина."[2] ▶ {quv HIja'chuqQo'!:sen:nolink} "Не говори со мной о чести!"[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a ceremony performed by the candidates during the Rite of Succession (see {cho'tay:n:hyp}).
церемония выполянется кандидатами во время ритуала посвящения (смотрите {cho'tay:n:hyp}).
▶ {ja'chuq Dalopchu'. Qang Damoj.:sen:nolink} "Complete the Rite of Succession to become Chancellor."[2]
▶ {ja'chuq Dalopchu'. Qang Damoj.:sen:nolink} "Завершите ритуал посвящения, чтобы стать канцлером."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column:
This follows the final noun.
In addition to nouns, {je:sen:nolink} can also follow a verb. See {je:adv}.

Следует за последним существительным.
In addition to nouns, {je:sen:nolink} can also follow a verb. See {je:adv}.
[1] {TKD:src}, [2] {SkyBox cards:src}, [3] {SkyBox 3:src} (reprinted in {HQ 3.4, p.10-11, Dec. 1994:src}), [4] {paq'batlh p.102-103:src}, [5] {Klingon Monopoly:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: auch (folgt dem Verb das es modifiziert)
همچنین (فعل آن را اصلاح می کند) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
também (segue o verbo que ele modifica)

When {je:adv:nolink} follows a verb, it means "also, too". {qaleghpu' je:sen:nolink} means "I also saw you, I saw you too", and as in English, its meaning is ambiguous. (It could mean "I and others saw you" or "I saw you and others".)[1]
Когда {je:adv:nolink} следует за глаголом, то это означает "также, тоже". {qaleghpu' je:sen:nolink} значит "Я также тебя видел"[1]
This is considered a noun conjunction, rather than an adverbial, in {TKD:src}.

▶ {SoHvaD 'uQ wej vIqem. Dargh vIqem je.:sen:nolink}[2] ▶ {jIghung. jIghung je. jI'oj. jI'oj je.:sen:nolink} (See {'avwI'vaD jatlh qama...:sen})[3] ▶ {notlh veS, 'a tugh manotlhchoH je maH.:sen} ▶ {pInaDqu' tuqlIj wInaDqu' je.:sen} ▶ {ghop luQan tajHommey. pe'laH je.:sen:nolink} (See {taj:n}.) ▶ {qep'a' wejDIchDaq jatlhtaH tlhIngan Hol HaDwI'pu'. ghoHtah je. tIv'eghtaH je. vaj SuquvmoH.:sen:nolink}[4] ▶ {chalqachDaq bIQaDbe' je:sen:nolink} "Even in a tower you are not safe."[5] ▶ {Qo'noSDaq boqwI'mey nejmeH je leng qeylIS 'ej chaHvaD lut ja':sen:nolink} "Kahless also went out to search for allies across Kronos, and told them his tale."[5] ▶ {QIStaqDaq cholonDI' jIyIn DaH jIyIn je:sen:nolink} "I am alive as I was when you left me at Kri'stak."[5]

table.name: mem
table.column: be thick, be dense, be viscous
vara tjock, vara seg, vara trögflytande
ser grosso, ser denso, ser viscoso
There is an idiom, {jeD; ghevI' rur@@jeD:v, ghevI':n, rur:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: Conquered people: more than slaves, less than citizens, this status is given to occupants of worlds conquered by the Klingon Empire.
Завоеванные люди: больше чем рабы, но меньше чем граждане. Этот статус дан оккупированным в тех мирах, что завоевала Клингонская империя.

table.name: mem
table.column:
The idiomatic expression {jej pach@@jej:v, pach:n} "the claw is sharp" means "the food is pungent (that is, good)".
There is also an idiom, {jej; Daqtagh rur@@jej:v, Daqtagh:n, rur:v}.

Идиоматическое выражение {jej pach@@jej:v, pach:n} "коготь острый" означает "еда острая (и это хорошо)".
Есть также идиома, {jej; Daqtagh rur@@jej:v, Daqtagh:n, rur:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: کسل کننده باشد، بی نهایت (از تیغه ها) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara slö, vara oskarp, vara trubbig (om egg)
быть затупленным, быть туповатым, быть тупым(характеристика клинка)
The idiomatic expression {jejHa' pach} "the claw is dull" means "the food is bland (that is, bad)".
Идиоматическое выражение {jejHa' pach} "коготь тупой" означает "еда мягкая (это плохо)".

table.name: mem
table.column: Iodine gel is used for washing wounds.

table.name: mem
table.column: This can mean "feel" in the meaning of "sensing" something (like a Betazoid might), but it can also be used for a machine that detects something.
In {TOS - The Empath:src}, "Gem" was the nickname given by Dr. McCoy to an empath.
[1] {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2017:src}, [2] {DSC - Si Vis Pacem, Para Bellum:src}

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is the name of the {HoD:n} of the {'entepray':n:name}. His first officer is {SIpoq:n:name}.
Note that {jemS:n:nolink} and {qIrq:n:nolink} do not follow proper Klingon phonology, since they are part of an alien name.

Это имя {HoD:n} корабля {'entepray':n:name}.
Заметьте, что {jemS:n:nolink} и {qIrq:n:nolink} не следуют правильной Клингонской фонологии, с момента, как они являются частью имени.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a building built for protection or fortification.
Himeji Castle is a famous landmark in Japan.

table.name: mem
table.column: Это слово нельзя применять к описанию размеров людей.

table.name: mem
table.column: A Klingon would recognise a Terran penguin as a {tera' jentu':n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This can also be used to refer to a saucer (see {Dargh HIvje':n}).

table.name: mem
table.column: sticka ut från, skjuta ut ur
The object is the thing from which the subject protrudes.
▶ {chor jeq taj:sen:nolink} "a knife protrudes from a belly"[2] ▶ {tajwIj 'oHbe' chorlIj jeqbogh Dochvetlh'e'.:sen:nolink} "That is not my dagger protruding from your midsection."[3]

table.name: mem
table.column: surge (aircraft suddenly moves forward or backward)
ruckeln (Flugzeug bewegt plötzlich vor- oder rückwärts)
افزایش (هواپیما به طور ناگهانی به جلو یا عقب حرکت می کند) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara ryckande, vara i plötsligt rörelse framåt eller bakåt (om flygmaskin)
激增（飛機突然向前或向後移動） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
ser espasmódico (aeronaves de repente avançam ou recuam)
This verb has no known meaning outside of the context of aircraft attitude descriptions.[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This verb does not take an object, and is generally in a phrase following a phrase saying what the subject of {jeS:v:nolink} is participating in.[2]

All of the following can be translated as "I participate in the {qepHom@@qep:n, -Hom:n}," though the literal meaning of each is distinct. ▶ {qaStaHvIS qepHom jIjeS.:sen:nolink} "While the qepHom is happening, I participate." ▶ {qaS qepHom 'ej jIjeS.:sen:nolink} "The qepHom is happening, and I participate." ▶ {qaS qepHom vaj jIjeS.:sen:nolink} "The qepHom is happening, so I participate."[2]

Все нижеследующие предложения могут быть переведены, как "Я принимаю участие в {qepHom@@qep:n, -Hom:n}," хотя дословные значения каждого из них различны. ▶ {qaStaHvIS qepHom jIjeS.:sen:nolink} "Пока встреча идет, я участвую." ▶ {qaS qepHom 'ej jIjeS.:sen:nolink} "Встреча идет и я участвую." ▶ {qaS qepHom vaj jIjeS.:sen:nolink} "Встреча идет, так что я участвую."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This literally means "volunteer to participate". It can be used even if the signing up isn't entirely voluntary. It is used both for signing up for something in advance or deciding on the spot to participate in an event which is about to start.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a loanword from {DIvI' Hol:n}.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This is a weather word, rather than a military word. This is made clear by the homophonous {jev:v:2}. (For the military meaning of "storm", consider {yov:v}.)
This verb is used in Sonnet 116, where its explicit subject is {muD:n:nolink}.[2]
Это слово применяется скорее для погодного явления.

table.name: mem
table.column: Note the homophonous {jev:v:1}. Apparently, Klingons view storms as a form of wheezing or noisy breathing by the atmosphere.

table.name: mem
table.column: побеждать, нанести поражение, уничтожать, разбивать врага
This sounds like the Hindi for victory.

table.name: mem
table.column: dubbelhövdad yxa, yxa med dubbelt blad
There is an idiom, {yuD; jey'naS rur@@yuD:v, jey'naS:n, rur:v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: تغذیه (شخص دیگری)، روح را غنی سازد [AUTOTRANSLATED]

table.name: mem
table.column: This refers only to hair on the top of the head, and not to facial hair (see {rol:n} and {loch:n}) or body hair (see {pob:n}).
Это относится только к волосам на верхней части головы, а не на лице (смотрите {rol:n} и {loch:n}) или теле (сотрите {pob:n}).
The "cut of someone's jib" is an idiom referring to their appearance.

table.name: mem
table.column:
Maltz thought maybe an early form of torture or execution was hanging people by their hair, but he wasn't sure about this and may have just been reacting to the homophony.
A "gibbet" is a structure used for public execution. It's also a term for the projecting arm of a crane, another word for which is the "jib".

table.name: mem
table.column: This is simply the verb {jIb:v} with the suffix {-'egh:v}.
This was defined as "suicide by hanging" but it's clearly a verb.

table.name: mem
table.column: This was spoken by Worf (in Klingon) during his Rite of Ascension.
Это сказано Ворфом во время ритуала посвящения.

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: Note that {jIH:n:2,nolink} refers to the device, while {HaSta:n} refers to the visual information displayed on it. {HaSta:n} and {wIy:n} are among the views which can be shown on a {jIH:n:2,nolink}.

Заметьте, что {jIH:n:2,nolink} относится к устройству, в то время как {HaSta:n} относится к графиеской информации, отображенной на нем.{HaSta:n} и {wIy:n} среди видов, которые могт быть показаны на {jIH:n:2,nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {jolbogh ghom wa'DIch DamuvlaHmeH De' DaneHchugh, Se'vam yIjIHtaH!:sen:nolink} "Stay tuned for information on how you can be among the first to beam aboard!"[2]

▶ {jolbogh ghom wa'DIch DamuvlaHmeH De' DaneHchugh, Se'vam yIjIHtaH!:sen:nolink} "Оставайтесь на связи для получения информации, каким образом вы можете быть в числе первых, кого поднимут на борт!"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: The subject is the cooperating parties.
This is missing from E-K side of {TKD:src}, and furthermore the K-E side defines it as "cooperate". However, {KGT:src} clarifies that this word means "be cooperative".

▶ {DuraS tuq tlhIngan yejquv patlh luDub 'e' reH lunIDtaH DuraS be'nI'pu' lurSa' be'etor je. ngoQvam luchavmeH ghawran maghpu' be'nI'pu'. woQ luSuqmeH jIjpu' chaH romuluSngan'e' je.:sen:nolink} "The sisters of the House of Duras, Lursa and B'Etor, are constantly seeking a higher standing for the House of Duras within the Klingon High Council. To this end, the sisters have acted against Gowron, going as far as to work with Romulan factions in order to gain power."[3]

▶ {DuraS tuq tlhIngan yejquv patlh luDub 'e' reH lunIDtaH DuraS be'nI'pu' lurSa' be'etor je. ngoQvam luchavmeH ghawran maghpu' be'nI'pu'. woQ luSuqmeH jIjpu' chaH romuluSngan'e' je.:sen:nolink} "Сёстры из дома Дюраса, Лурса и Бетор, постоянно ищут высокого положения для дома Дюраса внутри клингонского высшего совета. В конце, сёстры выступили против Гаурона, зайдя так далеко, что работали с ромуланскими группировками, чтобы усилить власть."

table.name: mem
table.column: The stars will talk before I will.
Bevor ich spreche, sprechen die Sterne.
ستارگان قبل از اینکه من بخواهم صحبت کنند [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Stjärnorna kommer att prata innan jag vill. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
星星會在我說話之前說話。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
As estrelas vão falar antes de mim.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a private joke referring to a specific person.

table.name: mem
table.column: Я принимаю эту честь или дословно "Я принимаю твою честь"
This is spoken to accept a request to become somebody's {cha'DIch:n:2}.
Это сказано, чтобы принять просьбу стать чьим-то {cha'DIch:n:2}.

table.name: mem
table.column:
This verb refers to a movement of the shoulders.
This verb can also be applied to aircraft, for which see {jIm:v:2}.

▶ {jIm SuvwI' volchaHDu':sen@@jIm:v:1, SuvwI':n, volchaH:n, -Du':n} "the warrior's shoulders shrug" ▶ {jIm SuvwI':sen@@jIm:v:1, SuvwI':n} "the warrior shrugs" (most common for {volchaH:n} to be left out) ▶ {volchaHDu'Daj jImmoH SuvwI':sen@@volchaH:n, -Du':n, -Daj:n, jIm:v:1, -moH:v, SuvwI':n} "the warrior shrugs his/her shoulders" (If the context is clear, {-Du':n} and/or {-Daj:n} can be dropped.)

table.name: mem
table.column: heave (aircraft rising or falling without pitching)
heben und senken (eines Flugzeugs ohne sich zu neigen; absacken)
هوا (هواپیما افزایش یا افتادن بدون سنگ فرش) [AUTOTRANSLATED]
vara stigande eller sjunkande, vara lyftande eller fallande (om flygmaskin)
升起（飛機上升或下降而不投球） [AUTOTRANSLATED]
levantamento e abaixamento (de uma aeronave sem inclinação; queda)
This is just the verb {jIm:v:1} applied to aircraft.
This may be a reference to the maneuver used by Kirk in {Star Trek II:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column:
The object of this verb is usually a phrase, and cannot be a thing.
To express a wish for something to happen, see {-jaj:v}.
A reference to the genie (or jinn) of Arabian mythology.
▶ {tlhIngan jIH 'e' vIjIn.@@tlhIngan:n, jIH:n:1, 'e':n, vI-:v, jIn:v} "I wish I were a Klingon."

table.name: mem
table.column: amulet symbolizing a girl's coming of age
Amulett welches die Reife eines Mädchens symbolisiert
عروسی نماد یک دختر از سن است [AUTOTRANSLATED]
amulett som symboliserar en flickas mognad
象徵著女孩成年的護身符 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Amuleto que simboliza a maturidade de uma menina

table.name: mem
table.column: MO confirmed at {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2011:src} that {jIr:v:nolink} is intransitive. (This was already known from the existence of {jIrmoH:v:nolink}.)

table.name: mem
table.column: twirl bat'leth, cause bat'leth to rotate
چرخش بته، باعث می شود بطول به چرخش [AUTOTRANSLATED]
snurra en bat'leth, få en bat'leth att rotera
girar bat'leth, fazer o bat'leth girar

table.name: mem
table.column: Whoop-dee-doo!, La-dee-dah!, Who cares?!, Big deal!
اوه، دیو-دوو !، لا-دی-دا !، چه کسی مراقبت ؟، معامله بزرگ! [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Whoop-dee-doo !, La-dee-dah !, Vem bryr sig ?!, Big deal! [AUTOTRANSLATED]
哇哇哇哇！La-dee-dah！，誰在乎？！，大不了！ [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Não importa. Quem se importa? Desinteressante
This is used to express that one is not exactly impressed by what someone has just said.

table.name: mem
table.column: Меня не волнует, меня не заботит

table.name: mem
table.column: This is a reference to Imhotep ({jItuj:sen@@jI-:v, tuj:v} means "I'm hot").

table.name: mem
table.column: This word is similar to {HeSwI':n}, which is used to refer to someone who breaks a law. This word connotes, in addition, being evil.[1]

The German subtitles, and apparently an earlier version of the English subtitles, use "terrorist" to translate this word.
The first half of the example sentence was a lip-match for the beginning of {'ej jIHvo' nIHDI' jIbup:sen@@'ej:conj, jIH:n:1h, -vo':n, nIH:v, -DI':v, jI-:v, bup:v}.
▶ {ghach jIvvo' naH. DaH pIghvamDaq So''eghtaH.@@ghach:v, jIvvo':n, naH:v, DaH:adv, pIgh:n, -vam:n, -Daq:n, So':v, -'egh:v, -taH:v} "There is a criminal hiding in these ruins."[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: ser umami (um dos cinco gostos básicos do paladar humano), saboroso, ser terroso
The umami taste comes from glutamate, the "G" in "MSG".

table.name: mem
table.column: Siehe wie Gowron dies sagt: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/BU7q3h2D9Mk}
Смотрите, как Гаурон говорит это: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/BU7q3h2D9Mk}

table.name: mem
table.column: This isn't "definition" like would be found in a dictionary, but a quick tag to give an idea of what a word means.

table.name: mem
table.column: A reference to the composer George Frideric Handel.

table.name: mem
table.column: luta sig ned, böja sig, luta framåt

table.name: mem
table.column: Lady, Lord (title for head of house)
Senhora, Senhor (título do chefe da casa)
In Klingon, titles go after the name.
В Клингонском языке титулы идут после имени

In {TKD:src}, this was defined as "lord". In {KGT:src}, this was expanded to "Lady, female head of house" and "Lord, male head of house".
In the "Radio Times Star Trek 30th Anniversary Special Issue", Lady Di (Diana, Princess of Wales) is translated as {Day joH:n:nolink}.[3]
[1] {TKD:src}, [2] {KGT:src}, [3] {Radio Times Star Trek 30th Anniversary Special Issue:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: For the area within an object, see {qoD:n} or {botlh:n:1}. See also {lurgh:n} for other words related to spatial directions.
Для территории внутри объекта, смотрите {qoD:n} или {botlh:n:1}. Смотрите также {lurgh:n} для других слов, относящихся к пространственным направлениям.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is someone who is between ({joj:n}) two parties and says "okay" ({lu':excl}) to both of them.

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {DIvI' 'ejDo' 'entepray'Daq Dajollu'.:sen:nolink} "Поднятый на борт корабля Энтерпрайз."[2] ▶ {jolbogh ghom wa'DIch DamuvlaHmeH De' DaneHchugh, Se'vam yIjIHtaH!:sen:nolink} "Оставайтесь на связи для получения информации, каким образом вы можете быть в числе первых, кого поднимут на борт!"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: This is better known as a "transporter beam", but {TKD:src} uses "transport beam" consistently.

table.name: mem
table.column: برو به اتاق حمل و نقل! [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Vá para a sala de transporte!

table.name: mem
table.column: This word is defined as "transporter ionizer unit" in {TKD:src}, but this is certainly a transposition of "transporter unit ionizer", a component of the transporter system mentioned in {TOS - The Enemy Within:src}.

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {jol SeHlaw lItHa'!@@jol SeHlaw:n, lItHa':v} "Get off that transporter control panel!"[1]
▶ {jol SeHlaw lItHa'!@@jol SeHlaw:n, lItHa':v} "Уйди от этой панели управления транспортером!"[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: پرتو حمل و نقل را فعال کردن [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Siehe wie Gowron dies sagt: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/Tvtfxst0IJ8}
Смотрите, как это говорит Гаурон: {YouTube video:url:http://youtu.be/Tvtfxst0IJ8}

table.name: mem
table.column: This verb is used colloquially with {'eb:n} to express the idea of "seizing an opportunity".[2]
Глагол используется в просторечии с {'eb:n} чтобы выразить идею "использования подвернувшейся возможности".[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: engenharia, localização de controle do motor

This refers to the place where the engines are controlled, whether that's where the engines are or somewhere else. If the engines and the engine-control place are the same, then {jonta' pa':n} would work to describe it.
[1] {Saarbrücken qepHom'a' 2017:src}, [2] {DSC - The Butcher's Knife Cares Not for the Lamb's Cry:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: This word is a side-effect of the backfit that also gave us {qama':n}.

table.name: mem
table.column: jonlu'meH wo'maj pop tIn law' Hoch tIn puS.
Our Empire's highest bounty has been placed on his head.
Für seine Ergreifung hat unser Reich die höchste Belohnung ausgesetzt.
بالاترین فضل امپراطوری ما در سر او قرار دارد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Vårt rikets högsta bounty har placerats på hans huvud. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Наша высшая имперская награда была помещена в его голову
我們帝國最高的恩惠已經擺在他的頭上。 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
A maior recompensa de nosso império foi colocada sobre sua cabeça.
[1] {Star Trek V deleted scene:src}, [2] {HQ 8.4, p.12, Dec. 1999:src}

table.name: mem
table.column: This idiomatic expression literally means "to lunge and deflect".

table.name: mem
table.column: This is an extension of {jop:v:1} to gaming or other situations where players, etc., act in a predefined order. To express the concept of taking turns, use {baQ:v:3}.
▶ {jIjop:sen@@jI-:v, jop:v:2} "it's my turn" ▶ {yIjop:sen@@yI-:v, jop:v:2} "take your turn!" ▶ {bIjopnIS:sen@@bI-:v, jop:v:2, -nIS:v} "you need to take your turn"

table.name: mem
table.column: This verb is also used to indicate the beating of a heart ({tIq:n}).[2]
Этот глагол также используется, чтобы обозначить сердцебиение ({tIq:n}).[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: You "rib" someone when you make a joke about them.

table.name: mem
table.column: strip of material in a susdek instrument
نوار مواد در یک ابزار سازنده [AUTOTRANSLATED]
tira de material em um instrumento susdek

table.name: mem
table.column: It is written {jorneb:n:nolink} in the {KGT:src} body text and in the E-K word list. The K-E side has {jornub:n:nolink}.

table.name: mem
table.column: نمایش، صحنه، منظره، دید، چشم انداز [AUTOTRANSLATED]
視圖、場景、風景、景觀、景觀 [AUTOTRANSLATED]
George Chann was a landscape painter.

table.name: mem
table.column: This is an archaic and upper-class word with the same meaning as {tlhorghHa':v}.

table.name: mem
table.column: This means to take an object down off a shelf or other overhead structure.

table.name: mem
table.column: This word does not appear in canon. However, when it was suggested to MO that {jotlhHa':v:nolink} would mean "put up" since {jotlh:v:nolink} means "take down", he corrected it by saying that "put back up" would be a better translation.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column:
"Joy".
In the novel {Sarek:src}, the word {be'joy':n} is used for a form of ritualized torture performed by women.

table.name: mem
table.column: blow into a container of some kind
ضربه به یک ظرف از نوع [AUTOTRANSLATED]
blåsa in i en behållare av något slag [AUTOTRANSLATED]
soprar em um recipiente de algum tipo

This means "inflate, fill with air, blow up". This is used for blowing up a balloon, a paper bag, a bubble, and so on. Unlike with {SuS:v}, air is trapped in the thing that's blown into and can't come out until it's let out (or the thing breaks).
If {-Daq:n} is used, it implies a miss: air was blown towards the object, but bypassed it.
"Bazooka Joe" is the mascot of the Bazooka brand of bubble gum. {ba'Suq'a' jo':sen@@ba'Suq:n, -'a':n, jo':v} means "he blows a great bubble".
inflate, fill with air, blow up

table.name: mem
mem
table.column: breit sein, eine Breite von ... haben
For measuring a flat object such as a tabletop, {juch:v:nolink} and {'aD:v} are used for the two dimensions.[1]

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {tlhIngan juHqo'Daq tlhIng yoSDaq 'oH toQDuj chenmoHlu'meH Daq wa'DIch'e':sen@@tlhIngan:n, juHqo':n, -Daq:n, tlhIng yoS:n, -Daq:n, 'oH:n, toQDuj:n, chenmoH:v, -lu':v, -meH:v, Daq:n, wa'DIch:n, -'e':n} "1st Construction Site: The Kling District, Klingon Home World"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: I will take that to my home.
Ich werde dies mit nach Hause nehmen.
من آن را به خانه من خواهم برد. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Jag ska ta det till mitt hem. [AUTOTRANSLATED]
Я заберу это в свой родной мир
我會帶那件東西回我家。
Vou levar isso para minha casa.

table.name: mem
table.column: ▶ {Quj wa'DIch juH qachmey mebpa'mey je qa' raQmey chu' monmey chu' je:sen:nolink} "Custom OUTPOSTS and CAPITALS replace original Houses and Hotels"[2]
▶ {Quj wa'DIch juH qachmey mebpa'mey je qa' raQmey chu' monmey chu' je:sen:nolink} "Пользовательские заставы и столицы заменены оригинальными домами и отелями"[2]

table.name: mem
table.column: See {wov:v} for how to describe a sunny day.
A reference to Juliet from Shakespeare's play, where Romeo says that "Juliet is the sun". A "Joule" is also a unit of energy.

table.name: mem
table.column: Aside from the fact that Helium comes from the Greek word for "Sun" (helios) (see {jul:n}), helium was also first detected by Jules Janssen.

table.name: mem
table.column: This means "odd" as in peculiar, unexpected, fishy.[2]

table.name: mem
mem
table.column:
This is the general verb for measurement. The subject of this verb is taking the measurement of the object.[2]
To indicate the length, width, and depth of an object, see {'aD:v}, {juch:v}, and {Saw':v}, respectively. For objects which are much longer or taller than they are wide, use {'ab:v} instead of {'aD:v}. The Klingon unit of linear measure is the {'uj:n}.
Distances can be described using {chuq:n}, {Sum:v}, and {Hop:v}. For large distances, use {qelI'qam:n}; for even larger (e.g., interstellar) distances, use {loghqam:n}.
To express an area, use {men:v}. See also {morgh:n} for a unit of area.
To express a volume, use {muq:v} (see also {tIn:v}, {mach:v}). See {tlho'ren:n} for a unit of volume.
To express a weight (mass), use {ngI':v} (see also {tIS:v}, {'ugh:v}). See {cheb:n} for a unit of weight or mass.
To express a temperature, use {gheH:v}. See {SImyon:n} for a unit of temperature.

Это общий глагол для описания измерения. Субъект этого глагола принимает замер объекта.[2]
Чтобы указать на длину, ширину и глубину объекта, смотрите {'aD:v}, {juch:v}, и {Saw':v}, соответственно. Для объектов, у которых длинп или высота больше, чем ширина, используйте {'ab:v} вместо {'aD:v}. Клингонская единица для линейной меры будет {'uj:n}.
Расстояния могут быть описаны, используя {chuq:n}, {Sum:v}, и {Hop:v}. Для больших расстояний используйте {qelI'qam:n}; для очень больших расстояний, используйте {loghqam:n}.
To express an area, use {men:v}. See also {morgh:n} for a unit of area.
Чтобы выразить объем, используйте {muq:v} (смотрите также {tIn:v}, {mach:v}). Смотрите {tlho'ren:n} для единицы объема.
Чтобы выразить вес(массу), используйте {ngI':v} (смотрите также {tIS:v}, {'ugh:v}). Смотрите {cheb:n} для единицы веса или массы.
